meanings.definition: To separate fibers from woody material by beating or scraping
meanings.sent1: She was scutching the fibers to make them softer.
meanings.sent2: Farmers scutch the flax to extract the fibers for weaving.
meanings.sent3: The children found joy in scutching the fibers for their art project.
meanings.sent4: The old machine scutched the fibers with a rhythmic sound.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic motion of scutching created a soothing atmosphere in the workshop.

meanings.definition: The process of removing impurities from fibers by beating or scraping
meanings.sent1: The scutching of the fibers was a crucial step in the textile production.
meanings.sent2: After scutching, the fibers were ready for spinning into yarn.
meanings.sent3: The scutching machine hummed as it worked tirelessly to clean the fibers.
meanings.sent4: The scutching process revealed the pure white fibers hidden beneath the dirt.
meanings.sent5: The workers took pride in their scutching skills, ensuring only the best fibers were used.
